page.title: 10RELIGION IN NENTHEAD
page.content: John Wesley visited and preached in Nenthead in 1748 and 1770 and ever since Methodism has dominated the area.The Methodist Chapel was built in 1823.Services are held every Sunday. Average congregation is 12.The Sunday School is held there every Sunday morning and is well supported by C.of E.children too <20 usually attend>. The Parish Church <St.John's C.ofE.> was built in 1845 on land given by the London Lead Co..The Parish is in the Diocese of Newcastle although Nenthead is in Cumbria.There has been no resident vicar since 1949.It is now grouped with Alston,Garrigill,Lambley, Kirkhaugh and Knaresdale in the charge of Rev'ds N.Taylor and P.Lambert. Sunday morning services are taken by F.W.Rogers M.A.Ph.D.<lay reader> and twice monthly Rev'd N.Taylor takes a Communion Service.Av.congreg.is 6.
